awd_titl_txt: SBIR Phase II:  Removing the Purification Bottleneck in Biopharmaceutical Production
awd_abstract_narration:
The broader impact of this Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase II project is to remove the purification bottleneck in biopharmaceutical production.  Protein engineering has enabled the new experiments to better understand the molecular basis of disease and to aid in the discovery of new biopharmaceuticals.  However, low-cost purification of the protein of interest from thousands of other proteins remains a challenge.  Access to inexpensive proteins for study will accelerate drug discovery with an estimated 10x savings.  The proposed project will optimize development at scale. 

The proposed project will advance the translation of a suite of protein purification solutions at various operational scales.  The proposed project will optimize a research-scale kit for recombinant protein purification for an estimated eighty percent of the purifications performed in research today.  Specialized kits for high yield and purity will be developed for the remaining twenty percent.  Enzymes used to remove an affinity tag from the protein of interest after it has been purified will be developed at scale.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships

por.por_cntn:
Proteios Technology, Inc. (http://www.proteios.com/) has developed a series of recombinant protein purification kits based on a novel affinity tag (Proteios Car9).  Proteios Car9 is a proprietary dodecapeptide with high affinity to silica, and purification methods based on the technology offers numerous advantages over currently-available technologies, including:

  • Simple cloning methods to add the affinity tag to the protein of interest (POI) at the N- or C- terminus;
  • Low-cost and biologically-safe silica-based matrix – the main component of purification kits;
  • Provides high yield and high purity of POI in less than 15 minutes;
  • Biological-safe reagents;
  • Effective for the purification of metalloproteins;
  • Effective for the purification of histidine-rich proteins;
  • Easily scaled for higher yields;
  • The small size of the affinity tag typically does not impact protein functionality;
  • The affinity tag can be removed with the Proteios TEV Protease kit.

 Proteios has developed the following products based on the Car9 affinity tag:

  • High-Expressing Protein (HEP) Purification Kit - provides up to 8mg of purified protein with an average purity above 98% in less than 30 minutes
  • Low-Expressing Protein (LEP) Purification Kit - provides up to 2mg of purified protein with an average purity > 90% in less than 15 minutes
  • High-Yield Kit - provides up to 90mg of purified protein within 20 minutes with a purity > 90%
  • Mini-Spin Kit - provides up to 60µg of protein in less than 10 minutes with a purity > 90%
  • High-Throughput Protein Purification Platform - based on a 96-well plate format and directly purifies targets from 2mL of bacterial culture providing about 50µg of purified protein with average purity of 80%
  • Car9 Affinity Tag Removal Kit - for the cleavage of Proteios Car9 affinity tag from up to 2mg protein with > 75% recovery of untagged POI and > 98% purity
  • His Affinity Tag Removal Kit - removes His tag from His-tagged Protein on NTA resin using Car9-tagged TEV protease with > 90% efficiency and > 98% purity
  • FPLC Protein Purification Kit - provides high-purity isolation of high- to low- expressed proteins in E. coli

Proteios is currently developing a single-step, tag-free protein purification technology for manufacturing workflows.  Contact Proteios Technology, Inc. (http://www.proteios.com/) to inquiry about R&D partnerships.
